intro: Pilosella niphostribes subsp. glaucophylla, commonly known as the glaucophylla pilosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow composite flowers and hairy, grayish-green foliage. The species is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it typically grows in open, sunny habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
